title: Meditations & Markets, Marx's Predictions, Paul VanderKlay and The Elephant in the Room
description:
Karl and Ira join me to respond to Paul VanderKlay's video about Meditations on Moloch, a blogpost from Slatestarcodex. 
Paul's Video:   https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NfJ0yms0sOA&t=1910s
We discuss the Prisoner's Dilemma, the Fish Farm and 
theoretical ideas v. empirical reality.
Force is a natural consequence of utopian striving.
Game Theory
The circle of trust differs according to societies.
Private ownership an important preventative for the tragedy of the commons - 
The Yellow Vests (Gilet Jaunes) in France may have some legitimate grievances. Take heed.
Crony Capitalism - when the government picks winners and losers in the market rather than allowing the multitude of individuals to be the decision makers.
A true free market requires a free flow of capital. In today's world, there is no longer a true market for capital.
The U. S. constitution is based on the idea that Government is instituted to secure our natural rights, not to give them to us.
Paul VanderKlay's original video in which he talks about us and includes the material from Meditations on Moloch:
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=NfJ0yms0sOA&t=1910s
Karl suggests that Paul read some Thomas Sowell (or watch any of Thomas Sowell's wonderful youtube interviews)
Douglas Murray, The Strange Death of Europe, The Madness of Crowds
